title: Portfolio Website

title: Project: Handwritten Digit Recognition with CNN
description:
This project implements a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) to classify handwritten digits from the MNIST dataset. The model was trained using deep learning techniques to automatically extract spatial features from grayscale digit images, achieving high accuracy in digit recognition.

Key Highlights:

Dataset: MNIST (70,000 images of handwritten digits, 28x28 grayscale)

Approach: Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) built with deep learning libraries

Techniques: Convolution layers for feature extraction, pooling for dimensionality reduction, and fully connected layers for classification

Achievements: Achieved >98% test accuracy (depending on hyperparameters and training epochs)

Tools: Python, TensorFlow/Keras (or PyTorch if thatâ€™s what you used), Google Colab

Why it matters:
This project demonstrates the ability to design and train deep learning models for computer vision tasks. It highlights practical skills in data preprocessing, neural network architecture design, and performance evaluation, which are fundamental in real-world AI applications like OCR, image classification, and pattern recognition.

Link to the Project : https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1y0WAJ9L8ZGTdOrY8te5KfPjOGQc9vIJ_?usp=sharing
